description.narrative: Sustainable Forest and Land Management in the Dry Dipterocarp Forest Ecosystem of Southern Lao PDR aims to facilitate a transformative shift towards sustainable land and forest management in the forested landscape of Savannakhet Province.

activity-description.narrative: Savannakhet Province (Thapangthong, Phalanxay, Phin, Songkone, Xonnaboury districts), Lao PDR

receiver-org.narrative: Government of Lao People's Democratic Republ

description.narrative: 1.1 Strategic Environmental Assessment (SEA) guiding resource management and conservation decision-making in Savannakhet Province 1.2 Improved land use planning and management reduces degradation over 1060535 hectares of forest landscapes in Savannakhet Province, leading to unabated provision of ecosystem services such as water supply (quality), flood prevention and biodiversity conservation 1.3 Information management systems to guide land and resource use planning in Savannakhet Province 1.4 Inter-institutional and multi-sectoral coordinating bodies overseeing resource management activities in Savannakhet Province to ensure compliance with SEAs, ILUMPs and SEDPs 1.5 Public-private partnerships for sustainable land and forest management in Savannakhet Province 1.6 Public-private partnerships for sustainable land and forest management in Savannakhet Province 1.7 Consolidated technical guidance on the design and management of plantation forestry and agriculture in the Dry DipterocarpForest landscape improve the sustainability of such operations and reduce their impacts on the surrounding landscape 2.1 New Protected Areas gazetted and fully operational 2.2 Capacities of communities located within or adjacent to protected forests to effectively participate in SFM activities 2.4 Restoration of degraded Dry Dipterocarp Forests to counteract on-going and past land degradation (as measured in SFM Tracking Tool) 2.5 Capacities of communities located within or adjacent to protected forests to effectively participate in SFM activities 2.7 Biodiversity management /ecosystem service provision mainstreamed in forest landscape management in five priority districts resulting in improvements in the status of biodiversity and ecosystem services, indicated 3.1 Levels of investment in land use planning and forest management planning at the villages and district levels in the targeted landscape in Savannakhet province 3.2 Wildlife-based ecotourism products designed and operating in the

comment.narrative: 1.1 0 EAs have been carried out in Savannakhet Province 1.2 0 district land use plans based on detailed ecological information or integrated into development and investment decision processes 1.3 Information on natural resources and conservation priorities is incomplete and highly dispersed 1.4 No formal coordinating mechanisms exist for stakeholders involved in resource management and conservation 1.5 Existing public-private partnerships are ad-hoc mechanisms between individual companies and institutions 1.6 Existing public private partnerships are ad-hoc mechanisms between individual companies and institutions 1.7 General guidelines for plantation forestry and agriculture exist in Lao PDR, but are not specifically to the ecological conditions of Dry Dipterocarp Forest landscapes 2.1 0 2.2 FOrest-based communities have limited mechanisms or experience in SFM or community management of forest resources 2.3 0 ha 2.4 Approx. 1000 ha 2.5 Forest-based communities have limited mechanisms or experience in SFM or community management of forest resources 3.1 USD 741,000 per year 3.2 0 projects operating 3.3 5< Conservation Agreements with communities in the Ong Mang Sanctuary

1.1 Draft SEA guideline and its decree; SEA consultation workshop report; Baseline data and maps and report; Consultation report 1.2 Report on ISPs implementation; Consultation workshop report ; Report on baseline data; Report on consultation of village cluster leaders 1.3 Information management systems to guide land and resource use planning in Savannakhet Province installed; Equipment and software for to support systems to guiding land and resource use planning installed; Training reports on DSS, including databases, GIS software etc 1.4 DSS System established and managed by DOF/ PAFO staff; Multi-sectoral stakeholder communicates established and meeting regularly at each of the 5 districts by end of year 1 1.5 Documented input on policies & regulations related to SFM, land use planning etc; Provincial level Responsible Business Forum established and meeting regularly ; Laws and policies printed and disseminated 1.6 Training completed and reports produced; Study tour to Thailand completed as part of capacity buidling 1.7 Guidelines on Sustainable Plantation Forestry and Agriculture developed by the end of year 3 2.1 Establish legal requiremens for upgrading and expansion of Ong Mang NPA and legal advice for target protected areas; Land use maps and maps defining boundaries of project area produced; Dry Dipterocarp Management Office/ Visitor Centre, 6 Field Stations construction completed; Equipped DDF cenre and sub-stations; Community consultation reports 2.2 Boundary signage for the target Protected Areas Equipment available for the Village Conservation Teams (VCT) and Government Rangers 2.3 Report detailing the legal requirement for upgrade of Ong Mang Sanctuary; Maps of boundaries and resource uses in proposed HCVF sites; Report on the consultation of community members on HCVF site designation 2.4 Community engagement reports; Suitable species for reforestation selected and documented; Payments made to local community residents for reforestation activities ; Record of payments made to local communities; Equipment and materials for reforestation activities procured; Seedling production to support project reforestation activities 2.5 Revised policies and technical guidelines to support village forestry management plans; Outreach and awareness of communities on the importance of Forest resources and SFM; Village level Land use plans; Capacity building training reports 2.7 Wildlife Specialist to design project activities related to BD monitoring and BD intactness index recruited; Biodiversity survey report; Capacity building training reports; Capacity building of provincial and district officials on PA Management; Patrolling teams set ip, and operational; Training report on Human-Elephant conflict 3.1 Ecosystem services values report; Construction of DDF Centre and sub-stations 3.2 Construction of DDF Centre and Sub-stations; Maps and site assessment reports/ documents; Documented joint action plans; Ecotourism consultation on reports; Technical guidance document wildlife- based ecotourism sub-projects 3.4 Socio-economic baseline assessment and value chain analysis in targe villages; Annual project progress review is conducted at the end of 2018

1.1 SEA guideline and its decree completed in February 2019.The baseline data and mapping undertaken between August and September 2018.Final consultation meeting held between December 2018 and January 2019. 1.2 Integrated spatial plans report completed ,signed by respective district governors and consultation held in target cluster villages. 1.3 Information management system development initiated with contract awarded in the last week of June and inception workshop held in Savannakhet Province held in September 2019.The consultancy firm have commenced the data collection on land and resource use to facilitate in system development. 1.4 DSS system development has commenced with involvement of DOF and PAFO staff,Multi-sectoral stakeholder committees established with regular meetings held in each of the targeted 5 districts. 1.5 Documented inputs on policies and regulations related to SFM and land use planning provided with final held on 29 November 2019.Provincial level responsible business forum established and regularly held with the lastest on held on 27 th September 2019 and attended by 154 participants(40 women). 1.6 Capacity Building training undertaken on protected area management with 30 participants(6 women).Capacity building training was also provided to 14 participants on use of GIS to assess the forest cover. 1.7 Guidelines on Sustainable Plantation Forestry and Agriculture developed and produced in July,2019 2.1 The legal requirements for upgrading Ong Mang Santuary established by the legal experts and the final workshop held in Savannakhet province on 21st June 2019 attended by 206 participants(20 women).The workshop concluded on the total area to be upgraded.6 field stations construction completed and DDF centre and substations equipped. 2.2 Boundary signage for target prtected areas installed and equipments for Village conservation teams and Government rangers availed. 2.3 Report detailing the legal requirement and procedure to up grade Ong Mang santuary produced by the legal experts.HCVF mapping and consultation with the community progressing. 2.4 Community engaged and suitable species produced in village nurseries and local communities participate in reforestation requirements and materials for reforestation procured.475, 000 Seedlings produced from tree nurseries supported by the project. 2.5 Technical guidelines and policies to support village forest management plans completed.Awareness on SFLM and conservation of endangered species created.Village land use plans completed. 2.7 Biodiversity monitoring protocols developed and Biodiversity intactness index done.Biodiversity survey report produced.Capacity building on ranger management and elephant -human conflict mitigation done involving provincial ,district and rangers. 3.1 Ecosystems services consultant recruitment initiated,Construction of DDF and substations completed 3.2 One ecotourism site launched in Dong Phou Vieng in January 2019 and Ong Mang ecotourism site development initiated.Ecotourism biodiversity study completed. 3.4 Socio economic baseline assessment and value chain analysis completed.Annual project progress review completed

1.1.1 Intensive training workshop completed, and training package produced 1.1.2 Consultation workshop conducted and report produced 1.1.3 Baseline data collected and report produced 1.1.4 Consultation workshop conducted and report produced 1.2 5 District- level ISPs completed and integrated with District Socio-Economic Development Plans (SEDPs) 1.3.1 DSS specialists/ firm contracted and DSS established 1.3.2 DSS training undertaken and training report produce 1.4.1 Multi-sectoral District Stakeholder Committees established, and meeting reported 1.4.2 Provincial-level Responsible Business Forum established, and meeting reported 1.5.1 Legal expert contracted, and related reports submitted 1.5.2 Consultation meetings conducted and reported 1.5.3 Law, regulations and policies printed and disseminated 1.6.1 Consultant contracted, and capacity building strategy developed 1.6.2 SFM /SLM / PA Trainings conducted, and reports submitted 1.6.3 Capacity building organized Land certificate issued 1.7.1 Specialist contracted, and action plan developed 1.7.2 Consultation meetings conducted and reported 1.7.3 Guidelines printed and disseminated 2.1.1 PA Legal expert contracted relevant reports on upgrade of Ong Mang NPA submitted 2.1.2 Current land uses assessed, and boundaries defined 2.1.3 Community consultations held, and reports produced 2.2.1 Boundary signs installed 2.2.2 Ecotourism infrastructure procured and installed 2.2.3 Patrolling implemented and reported using SMART reports 2.2.4 PA management training conducted and reported 2.3.1 PA Legal expert contracted and report on legal inputs into HCVF 2.3.2 Boundaries defined and current land uses assessed 2.3.3 Communities consulted on designation of HCFF site 2.4.1 Reforestation of 300 ha by local communities 2.4.2 Monitoring of 300 ha of reforested area 2.5.2 Outreach material on DDF values produced and disturbed 2.5.3 16 village forest management plans produced 2.6.1 Outreach material on PA and HCVF produced and distributed 2.6.2 Awareness raising materials produced and disseminated 2.7.2 Water monitoring equipment procured and installed 2.7.3 Human elephant conflict action plan developed 3.1.1 Finance mechanism specialist contracted to developing SFM financing 3.1.2 Ecosystem services values analysed 3.2.1 1 wildlife-based ecotourism projects operating in project target area 2.2.3 Ecotourism infrastructure procured and installed 3.2.4 Ecotourism awareness material produced, distributed and reported 3.3.1 Specialist contracted and develop PA and SFM financing 3.3.2 PA business plans developed 3.4.1 Community Conservation Agreements framework developed 3.4.2 16 Community Conservation Agreements 3.4.3 Small-scale community enterprise identified and supported

1.1.1 Training on the SEA development was held between July and August 2018 and training report prepared and submitted by DEQP to the SAFE Ecosystems Project team. 1.1.2 Consultation workshops on the SEA were held between October and November 2018 and report prepared and submitted by DEQP to the SAFE Ecosystems Project team. 1.1.3 In addition to the baseline data collected during the ISP process during 2017, additional collecting was implemented by DEQP during August and September through meetings and focus groups with each of the 5 target districts. 1.1.4 Final Consultation workshops on the SEA was held between December 2018 to January 2019 and a report is currently being prepared by DEQP and is expected to be submitted the SAFE Ecosystems Project team 1.2.1 Consultation workshops held with districts and village cluster leaders to discuss and confirm the findings, information and maps included in the respective ISPs. 1.2.2 Integrated Spatial plans were completed for the 5 target districts which cover a total area of 1,016,531 ha. 1.3.1 The Centre for Development and Environment (CDE) from the University of Bern has identified as a preferred partner to implement the Decision Support Systems under the existing framework – Lao Decide. CDE signed an MOU with National Institute of economic Research (NIER) in late September to undertake the 4th phase of Lao Decide. 1.3.2 Activity 1.3.2 is related to Activity 1.3.1. It is expected that full project activities are to commence by Q1 2019. 1.4.1 The SAFE Ecosystems project and the Savannakhet Department of Planning and Investment (DPI) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to establish and implement meetings for the multi-sectoral District Stakeholder Committees in the 5 target districts and the provincial-level Responsible Business Forum. 1.4.2 The first Responsible Business Forum was organized by the Savannakhet Department of Planning and Investment (DPI) in Xonnabouly District on 24 August 2018 to promote investment in ecotourism and corporate social responsibility in the tourism service sector. 1.5.1 After an extended procurement process, the International Environmental Lawyer and the National Legal Specialist were recruited in October 2018 and have initiated their consultancy activities to undertake Policy/Regulation review and revision for support of Sustainable Forest and Land Management. 1.5.2 Due to the delays in procuring the National Legal Specialist, multiple tasks will be implemented until November 2019. 1.5.3 The printing and dissemination of laws, regulations and policies were not completed in 2018 and delayed until 2019. 1.6.1 The National Capacity Building consultancy to undertake activities related to a capacity building needs assessment has been completed. 1.6.2 The results of the Capacity Needs Assessment and the Capacity Building Strategy have identified key areas of training and development required by staff within DOF, PAFO and the 5 DAFOs. 1.6.3 Village land use planning was undertaken by the village forest management and NTFP Division in collaboration with the villages resulting in the production of 16 village forest management plans, as reported in Q2 1.7.1 The National Sustainable Plantation Forestry / Agriculture Specialist was recruited and initiated consultancy activities in October 2018 1.7.2 The consultant had implemented a field visit in national, provincial, district and village level. The field mission in the national level was implemented during 29 October to 1 November 2018 1.7.3 Guidelines to be printed and disseminated upon completion and submission during Q1 2019. 2.1.1 After an extended procurement process, the International Environmental Lawyer and the National Legal Specialist were recruited in October 2018 and have initiated their consultancy activities to undertake Policy/Regulation review and revision for support of Sustainable Forest and Land Management. 2.1.2 Assessment and consultation with provincial and district stakeholders completed with the proposed protected area of 130,745 ha. 2.1.3 Assessment and consultation with provincial and district stakeholders completed with the proposed protected area of 130,745 ha. 2.2.1 A total of 396 concrete boundary posts were installed at a distance of 1 km between each post supporting the protection and management of 306,900 ha of NPAs and 107,858 ha of Protected Forest totalling 414,758 ha. Respectively, 132 posts were installed in Se Ta Noun Phounak PF, 132 in Dong Phouvieng NPA and 132 in Phou San Hey NPA; Management Plans for each of these areas have been drafted and are in the process of being reviewed. 2.2.2 Camera traps were set up in the potential areas for viewing wildlife in Ong Mang Sanctuary in order to identify locations for the installation of ecotourism infrastructure. 2.2.3 The VCT Rangers form part of the routine patrolling units tasked with conservation and monitoring wildlife in the core zones have continued to patrol the area and in the reporting period. 2.2.4 WWF Laos contracted to undertake training of PA managers and community rangers 2.3.1 After an extended procurement process, the International Environmental Lawyer and the National Legal Specialist were recruited in October 2018 and have initiated their consultancy activities to undertake Policy/Regulation review and revision for support of Sustainable Forest and Land Management. 2.3.2 Due to the delays in procuring the National Legal Specialist, multiple tasks will be implemented until November 2019. 2.3.3 Due to the delays in procuring the National Legal Specialist, multiple tasks will be implemented until November 2019. 2.4.1 The project reforestation efforts for 2018 covered 308 ha planting tree seedlings based on agreements signed between the project, DAFO and the villages. The agreements were based on lessons and guidelines from BCC project funded by ADB and also hosted in DOF. 2.4.2 As indicated in Activity 2.4.1, monitoring of reforested areas is currently being undertaken based upon community reforestation and conservation contracts signed between the project, DAFO and the villages 2.4.3 Tree nurseries were established in the 5 target districts and including a nursery in the Ong mang Eco-Centre. 2.5.2 10 CITES signs were produced in Q3 2018 and installed in various locations in Savannakhet and the 5 target districts as follows. 2.5.3 16 Village Forestry Management Plans have been finalized and approved by 5 target districts covering 53,948 ha. 2.6.1 Based on a request from the Governor of Savannakhet, the project has been working with the Governor’s office, Department of Public Works and DPI to produce Eld’s deer statues to be displayed on a round-about in Kaysone City 2.7.2 The SAFE Ecosystems Project entered an agreement with the Provincial Office of Natural Resource and Environment (PONRE) to implement water monitoring activities along Xe Bangxiang river. The letter of agreement was signed in May 2018. 2.7.3 WWF Laos contracted to undertake an assessment of the Human Elephant Conflict (HEC) in Phin District. 3.1.1 Terms of reference for the Finance Mechanism Specialist are currently being finalized with the procurement processes expected to commence in Q1 2019. 3.1.2 This activity will be coordinated with the Sustainable Financing Specialist Consultancy under Activity 3.1.2 and will be implemented in 2019. 3.2.1 The DDF and visitor centre and 5 sub-stations were finalized by the contractor, with the final physical check and certification done by the UNDP procurement Unit. 3.2.2 Marketing surveys completed in Kaysone, Savannakhet with approximately 540 respondents and the survey in Pakse, Champasak had 320 visitors responding to the survey with an average of 30% female respondents. Specific numbers and data will be updated in the next quarterly report. 3.2.3 Bicycle surveys for the Ong Mang area were completed in Q2/Q3 2018.; nfrastructure design The Project team prepared TOR to contract an architect to design ecotourism infrastructure e.g. sala that will be constructed in the two villages in Dong Phou Vieng NPA. Construction will be completed in Q1 2019. 3.2.4 Responsible business forum A major awareness raising event on ecotourism was organized as part of the responsible business forum as reported under output 1.4 3.2.6 Village guide training was conducted for 21 villagers and DAFO staff in Dong Phou Vieng NPA; Homestay Training 20 families in Ban Vongsikeo and 20 families from Ban Nyang in Dong Phou Vieng NPA participated in homestay training in December 2018. 3.3.1 Terms of reference for the Finance Mechanism Specialist are currently being finalized with the procurement processes expected to commence in Q1 2019. 3.3.2 This activity will be implemented once the finance mechanism specialist is contracted. 3.4.1.1 Support development of fund mechanism support framework in 16 villages through review of regulation, training and provision of materials for Village fund management committees etc (Eg: CA Provisions and training village committees, materials, ...) 3.4.1.2 Review and adopt standard operation procedures (SOP) / technical guidelines to implement support to community livelihood activities (Eg: CA aware & discussion on CA benefit, Procedures in 16 villages) 3.4.1.3 Monitor and follow up implementation of fund mechanism framework for community livelihood activities and use of technical guidelines/procedures in practice of 16 villages 3.4.1.4 Handicraft feasibility study and marketing survey by outside expert for detail data, woman meeting, group developing for production, support plan with district 3.4.2 Conservation agreements have been prepared and signed with 16 villages during Q4 20183.4.3.1 Technical support for livestock and fishery units, 5 districts (Workshop/training district staff, Providing of revolving fund and necessary equipment) 3.4.3.2 Village Vet capacity building/re-train and village vet revolving fund 3.4.3.3 Support of rice planting for higher yield (rice seeds, technique, bio-fertilizer etc.) 3.4.3.4 Support an attempt of disadvantage households for crop integrating with small livestock raising for income generation of disadvantage households from 8 villages 3.4.3.5 Village Forest Conservation activities and NTFP management in 16 villages including planting demonstration, and developing of animal production and water source to exchange for agreement to cease grazing in restricted forest zones 3.4.3.6 Training & equipping of disadvantage women from 16 villages on sewing skill trainers and revolving funds for small enterprise 4.1 The project was audited in February 2018.

1.3 Decision Support System developed with relevant government staff operating the system and software 1.4 5-target district level Multi-sectoral stakeholder meetings implemented 1.5 Key agencies support natural resource management and mainstream BD, SFM & SLM approaches into provincial and district level planning decision making. 2.1 Upgrade Ong Mang Sanctuary to National Level (IUCN Type 4). 2.2 Protected Area management staff have enhanced technical skills and supporting technology for planning, environmental monitoring, and enforcement. 2.3 Designation of HCVF areas submitted to Savannakhet Governor for approval. 2.4 Restoration of 350 ha Of Dry Dipterocarp Forest with native species in 2020 2.5 Revised rules and regulations for village forest management plans completed; Community land certificates issued for 16 villages 2.6 Stakeholder outreach and environmental education delivered. 2.7 Xe Bangxiang River monitored; 5 flagship species populations estimated from monitoring activities. 3.1 Current levels of investment in land use planning & forest management planning in the targeted landscape in Savannakhet Province established 3.2 3-wildlife-based ecotourism projects operating in project target area 3.3 Current funds available for management of protected areas / conservation forests in targeted landscape in Savannakhet Province from governmental and non-governmental sources established 3.4 16-Community-based Conservation Agreement negotiated, revised and implemented 4.1 Quarterly reporting and monitoring on the project implementation progress

1.3 Decision Support System development completed awaiting the official launch and training of government staff to operate the decision support system. 1.4 5-target district level Multi-sectoral stakeholder meetings undertaken. 1.5 Capacity building provided to key agencies support natural resource management and mainstream BD, SFM & SLM approaches into provincial and district level planning decision making. 2.1 Upgrade Eld`s deer national sanctuary( Ong Mang Sanctuary) to National Level (IUCN Type 4) completed covering 130745 hectares. 2.2 Protected Area management staff have enhanced technical skills and supporting technology for planning, environmental monitoring, and enforcement with training on SMART reporting training 2.3 Designation of HCVF areas submitted to Savannakhet Governor for approval completed. 2.5 Revised rules and regulations for village forest management plans completed; Community land certificates issued for 16 villages completed 2.6 Stakeholder outreach and environmental education delivered. 2.7 Xe Bangxiang River monitored 3.1 Current levels of investment in land use planning & forest management planning in the targeted landscape in Savannakhet Province established. 3.2 2-wildlife-based ecotourism projects operating in project target area 3.3 Current funds available for management of protected areas / conservation forests in targeted landscape in Savannakhet Province from governmental and non-governmental sources established 3.4 16-Community-based Conservation Agreement negotiated, revised and implemented 4.1 Quarterly reporting and monitoring on the project implementation progress
